titles.title: To authorize the transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign countries.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Mr. Hamilton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

calendar.text: Committee on Armed Services. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on Armed Services. Reported to Senate by Senator Nunn with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 516.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments pursuant to H. Res. 499.
Message on House action received in Senate and at the desk: House amendments to Senate amendments.
Senate agreed to the House amendments to the Senate amendments by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/1/1994--House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment. Authorizes the Secretary of the Navy to transfer, under specified conditions, to: (1) Australia the tank landing ships Saginaw and Fairfax County; (2) Brazil the tank landing ship Cayuga and the Miller and Valdez frigates; (3) Morocco the tank landing ship Bristol County; and (4) Spain the tank landing ship Barnstable County. Waives certain congressional notification requirements with respect to such transfers. Requires recipients to bear the transfer costs. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the Secretary should request each country to have each transferred vessel repaired or refurbished at U.S. shipyards (including U.S. navy shipyards).
